Literature Review: Noninvasive prenatal testing using circulating DNA and RNA has revolutionized obstetric care over the past decade, significantly reducing the need for invasive diagnostic procedures like amniocentesis for genetic disorders. The advent of cell-free nucleic acids (cfDNA and cfRNA) has enabled the detection of genetic abnormalities in fetal cells circulating in the maternal bloodstream. This noninvasive approach has transformed the field of prenatal screening, providing a safer and more efficient alternative to traditional invasive methods.
